Title: AI Engineer
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Vi søger en dygtig AI Engineer, der brænder for Machine Learning og AI samt for at bygge robuste, skalerbare og intelligente løsninger. Du bliver en central del af vores team, hvor vi udvikler AI-drevne produkter og services, der understøtter automatisering og innovation i den offentlige sektor.

Som AI Engineer vil du arbejde med hele værdikæden – fra design og udvikling af software til implementering af machine learning-modeller i produktion. Du får mulighed for at præge arkitekturen, optimere workflows og sikre høj kvalitet i vores løsninger.




Hvorfor er det her din næste karrieremulighed?




Du bliver en del af et ambitiøst team i krydsfeltet mellem økonomi, data og teknologi.
Du får indflydelse på, hvordan offentlige organisationer bruger data til at automatisere og træffe bedre beslutninger.
Du kommer til at arbejde på spændende projekter som KMD EasyPayment til automatisk bogføring samt understøtte vores øvrige løsninger med nye AI-kapabiliteter.




Dine opgaver




Udvikle og vedligeholde AI-løsninger i forskellige afskygninger – fra Machine Learning til AI Agenter.
Designe og implementere systemarkitektur baseret på microservices og cloud-teknologier (primært Microsoft Azure).
Kommunikere direkte med kunder for at forstå deres behov og omsætte dem til tekniske koncepter og AI-funktionalitet.
Sikre kvalitet gennem test, versionstyring og CI/CD pipelines.
Containerisere og orkestrere applikationer med Docker og Kubernetes.
Arbejde med orkestrering af modeller i Azure Machine Learning Studio.




Hvem er du?




Du kan lide at eksperimentere og tager ejerskab fra idé til produktion.
Du trives med at være proaktiv, stille spørgsmål, tage kontakt til teammedlemmer og holde momentum højt.
Du er tryg ved at arbejde tæt sammen med både udviklere, forretningen og kunder.
Du er i stand til at omsætte kundebehov til holdbare tekniske og AI-drevne løsninger.




Dine tekniske kompetencer:




Stærke kompetencer i:

Machine Learning, LLMs og
Python og moderne software udviklingsprincipper (design, test, versionskontrol, DevOps/CI/CD).
Systemarkitektur inkl. microservices, cloud services og SaaS-løsninger.
Containerization med Docker.




Gode kompetencer i:

Kubernetes til orkestrering.
Microsoft Azure, herunder Azure Machine Learning.




Teamet du bliver en del af




Du bliver en del af et nyt og voksende AI-team, hvor vi værdsætter tæt samarbejde, åbenhed og en hands-on tilgang. Du kommer til at arbejde direkte sammen med udviklere i Polen og Aalborg.




Vi tilbyder




Et innovativt miljø med fokus på AI og automatisering.
Mulighed for at arbejde med cutting-edge teknologier og komplekse problemstillinger.
Fleksible arbejdsforhold og en kultur, hvor videndeling og læring er i centrum.




Om KMD




KMD er den største danske it-virksomhed, der udvikler og leverer software- og serviceløsninger til kommune-, stats- og erhvervssegmentet i Danmark samt udvalgte segmenter i Skandinavien.




KMD har over 1.500 danske og internationale kunder. KMD-koncernen har en årlig omsætning på godt 4 mia. kr. og har cirka 2.800 ansatte. KMD er et datterselskab i den globale teknologikoncern NEC Corporation, der globalt beskæftiger mere end 100.000 medarbejdere.




KMD (et selskab under NEC) stræber mod at sikre lige muligheder. Derfor opfordrer vi alle kvalificerede og interesserede ansøgere til at søge vores ledige stillinger. Hos KMD baseres alle aspekter af ansættelse og samarbejde på merit, kompetence, præstation og forretningsmæssige behov, uden forbehold for race, hudfarve, religion, køn, seksuel orientering, kønsidentitet, national oprindelse, alder, handicap eller enhver anden status, der er beskyttet i henhold til lokal lovgivning om antidiskrimination.

Vil du være med til at forme fremtidens AI-løsninger i den offentlige sektor?

Kontakt: Mathilde Rüdinger Gadensgaard, mvf@kmd.dk

Lokation: Aalborg

Ansøgningsfrist: 22. december (Samtaler afholdes løbende)

Show more

KMD er den største danske it-virksomhed, der udvikler og leverer software- og serviceløsninger til kommune-, stats- og erhvervssegmentet i Danmark samt udvalgte segmenter i Skandinavien.

Title: Software developer - PAPI team
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About GoWish, Ønskeskyen ☁️
At GoWish, we’re building the world’s leading wish-list and social shopping platform — a place where you can make a real impact and have fun doing it.

We’re on a mission to reinvent gifting for millions. We win together, driven by curiosity, ownership, and bold ideas that turn into real products. We experiment cross-functionally, push for excellence, and keep things playful as we grow — together.

Team & role overview 


Our engineering department is organized into eight teams. As a Software Engineer on the Product API team, you’ll own everything related to e-commerce product data. You’ll work on some of our most essential systems — from ingesting product data through distributed feed imports and large-scale web scraping, to managing and optimizing storage for more than 3 billion products, and enabling other teams to build outstanding features on top of this data.

You’ll collaborate closely with our Cloud Engineering team, since our services run at extremely high throughput and require tight integration with our infrastructure. You’ll also work alongside Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Product Engineers on cross-functional initiatives.

This role is ideal for someone who wants to design and build highly scalable distributed microservices, handle billions of transactions per day, and truly take ownership in shaping the future of our platform.

Responsibilities:

Developing scalable, high-performance backend services using Node.js, NestJS, and TypeScript.
Building and optimizing advanced web scraping systems capable of handling billions of products daily.
Implementing real-time data pipelines and stream processing solutions using Kafka.
Leveraging in-memory caching with Redis to ensure extremely fast data retrieval and updates.
Working closely with our distributed NoSQL databases for handling large-scale data effectively.
Collaborating in a cross-functional agile team, participating actively in architectural discussions, code reviews, and knowledge-sharing sessions.




What We’re Looking For 🌟

Your Technical Skills

Strong expertise in Node.js and dependency injection frameworks such as NestJS.
Solid understanding and hands-on experience with Kafka or other stream processing tools.
Practical experience working with Redis or other in-memory databases for caching.
Proficient in managing and optimizing NoSQL or SQL databases.
Familiarity with cloud-native technologies, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and microservices architecture.
Experience managing distributed systems and microservices at scale


Who We're Looking For

A highly motivated individual who enjoys solving challenging technical problems and taking ownership of projects.
Someone excited about working with cutting-edge technologies on impactful, real-world problems.
Excellent communication skills, capable of clearly articulating complex technical topics.
A team player eager to share knowledge and learn from colleagues.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken).
Ability to work in our Copenhagen office 4 times per week.




Bonus Points For

Experience designing and implementing efficient web scraping systems.
Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL databases in production use-cases.
Experience with multi-cluster/multi-regional deployments and databases.
Experience with graph databases or advanced data storage solutions.
Proven knowledge of high-performance applications dealing with high I/O scenarios.
Experience using BigQuery or similar data warehouse for analytics and Grafana for monitoring and visualization.




Why GoWish should sit at the top of your career wish list 💙
At GoWish, we believe great work comes from people who feel energized, supported, and excited to show up every day. That’s why we’ve built a workplace where celebration, growth, and genuine enjoyment are part of the journey — not perks on the side.

Take your birthday off with Happy Birthday Leave, enjoy 30 days of vacation to fully recharge, and join a team that fills the year with events and playful happenings. We invest in your future with pension and insurance, fuel your days with a weekly lunch scheme, and keep you going with unlimited snacks and sodas — because work should feel good.

At GoWish, you don’t just build great products. You build a great work life.




Practical information
We collaborate in a flexible hybrid setup, with most of our magic happening at our bright, modern office in Østerbro — perfectly placed between Nordhavn and Østerport Station. We’re ready for you to join us as soon as you are.

👉 Ready to help shape a platform that already empowers 15+ million users (and counting)? Join us at GoWish — and let’s build the future of data-driven innovation together.



Show more

Title: Robotics/AI Student Assistant for J&J MedTech
Place: Birkerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

Job Function

Career Programs

Job Sub Function

Non-LDP Intern/Co-Op

Job Category

Career Program

All Job Posting Locations:

Birkerod, Capital, Denmark

Job Description

Please note that the role is based in Norrebro, Copenhagen, Denmark.

Johnson & Johnson MedTech Surgery is looking for a student helper for their office in Copenhagen.

J&J MedTech strives to provide next-generation visualization technologies to benefit surgeons and patients around the world! Our Copenhagen office at Titangade is looking for a student candidate to assist in building an exciting new project.

We’re after a curious, hands-on engineering student with interest in software, hardware, and problem-solving. If you know your way around Python and C++, with ROS or ROS 2 familiarity being a bonus, this is your chance to work with real-world robotic systems and make a meaningful impact on the next generation of medical devices.

Would you like to have the opportunity to learn from a group of expert computer vision, deep learning, robotics, and software engineers, with access to exciting robotic hardware in a central location in the Nørrebro district of Copenhagen?

The position is flexible, part-time at approximately 2 days a week. This is primarily an in-office position, with occasional remote flexibility to fit alongside your studies.

Key Responsibilities


Work closely with the team to develop robot control, imaging, and data recording software/infrastructure.
Data Design and Recording for AI training
Opportunities to also work on our other core projects.


Qualifications

Education:


Bachelor or similar in a relevant field, e.g. robotics/electrical engineering, or computer science
Ongoing study activities concerning software engineering (ongoing Master education or other relevant field).


Experience And Skills

Required:


Experience writing applications in Python and C++
Familiarity with Linux/Ubuntu


Preferred


Experience with the Robot Operating System (ROS/ROS 2)
Experience with AI projects (Jupyter Notebook, PyTorch)


Other


Strong English skills, both written and verbal


Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.

Title: AI Application Engineer
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Vil du være med til at forme og videreudvikle CEGOs AI-løsninger? Vi søger en AI Application Engineer, der kan bygge intelligente løsninger baseret på de nyeste teknologier og integrere dem direkte i kernen af vores tech-platform. Du bliver en del af et område i stærk udvikling og et team med højt fagligt niveau, hvor I sammen sætter retningen for CEGOs fremtidige AI-teknologier.




Om CEGO

CEGO er en ambitiøs softwarevirksomhed beliggende på havnefronten i Aalborg. Vi har en uformel arbejdskultur med højt til loftet, fleksibilitet og frihed under ansvar. Vi driver Spilnu.dk, et af Danmarks største online casinoer, og har udvidet vores succes til England med happytiger.co.uk. Vi udvikler (næsten) alt in-house ved hjælp af open source-teknologier - både spil, platform og vores AI-initiativer.




Om rollen

Vi søger en AI Application Engineer til vores nyetablerede datateam, hvor du skal være med til at udvikle fremtidens AI-løsninger med fokus på brug af Large Language Models (LLMs), Machine Learning (ML), AI-agenter og moderne AI-arkitekturer.




Med din tekniske værktøjskasse skal du være med til at forme, hvordan vi arbejder med AI hos CEGO. Du får et tæt samarbejde med vores udviklere i Platform-afdelingen, som tilbyder solid sparring og stærke faglige miljøer. Afdelingen rummer i alt 39 medarbejdere på tværs af devops, softwareudvikling, UX-design og frontend.




Dine primære arbejdsopgaver omfatter

Udvikle og implementere AI-løsninger baseret på LLM’er, AI-agenter og machine learning-teknikker såsom fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG (Retriever-Augmented Generation), ReACT og meta-prompting
Designe og optimere agentbaserede systemer med teknologier som fx LangChain, LangGraph og LangSmith eller lignende
Udvikle API’er og integrationer til at forbinde AI-løsninger med vores eksisterende systemer
Deltagelse i innovation og prototyping på tværs af teams og forretningsområder
Holde dig opdateret på relevante AI-trends og vurdere, hvordan de kan anvendes til at skabe værdi for forretningen




Om dig

Vi forestiller os, at du er en initiativrig holdspiller, der kombinerer din udvikler-profil med et kommercielt mindset, og at du desuden har:




Grundlæggende forståelse for machine learning og evnen til at skelne mellem klassiske ML-problemer og moderne LLM-applikationer
Kender til teknikker som prompt chaining og retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Kendskab til agentbaserede AI-systemer og orkestrering af arbejdsgange
Erfaring med API-udvikling og softwareintegration
Erfaring med evaluering og performanceoptimering af AI-modeller
En nysgerrig og læringsorienteret tilgang til nye teknologier




Vi tilbyder

Mulighed for at blive en del af en af Aalborgs mest attraktive og ambitiøse arbejdspladser. Vi kombinerer en stærk faglig kultur med høj grad af frihed og ansvar.




En forretning, hvor kunderne er slutbrugerne på vores websites. Vi definerer således selv vores målsætninger, og i hvilken retning vi skal arbejde for at lykkes
Ingen tidsregistrering af arbejdsopgaverne
En agil, flad organisation med hurtige beslutningsveje
Fleksible arbejdstider, 30 minutters betalt daglig pause og en politik om nul overarbejde
Fælles morgenmad, adgang til fitnessrum, personlig træning to gange om ugen og massage
Et arbejdsmiljø hvor faglighed, trivsel og samarbejde går hånd i hånd
Sundhedsforsikring og pensionsordning




Vi ved, at dygtige og engagerede medarbejdere skaber de bedste resultater. Derfor gør vi en aktiv indsats for at sikre et arbejdsmiljø, hvor du både bliver udfordret og trives.




Ansøgning

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Chief People & Culture Officer Dorthe Hammer Hovaldt på dhhj@cego.dk eller tlf. +45 2140 0848.




Upload dit CV og en motiveret ansøgning via vores website hurtigst muligt - vi behandler ansøgninger løbende. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt.




Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at søge – uanset køn, alder, religion eller etnisk baggrund.

Show more

Title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Overview

We are on a mission to ensure everyone has access to medical expertise, no matter where they are.

Half the world still lacks access to quality healthcare. Even in advanced systems, outcomes are uneven, and clinicians are overwhelmed. Medical knowledge grows faster than human capacity can keep up.

Corti is building the infrastructure to close that gap. Our AI platform expands access to medical expertise, reducing errors, restoring time to clinicians, and making care more affordable, accessible, and human again.

There is no quality healthcare without a quality dialogue, and no reliable AI without a strong foundation. Help us build both.

Why Corti?

Corti is building the intelligence layer for global healthcare. We give every developer, product team, and healthcare innovator access to medical-grade AI, so the world can deliver care that is faster, safer, and more human.

Built entirely for healthcare and adjacent industries, Corti’s models are trained on real-world data and optimized for precision, safety, and regulatory trust.

Through modular APIs, teams can embed medical speech recognition, summarization, reasoning, and much more directly into healthcare products without reinventing the foundation.

We power the builders who are redefining how healthcare works, from startups creating new patient experiences to enterprises modernizing the systems that care depends on.

If you believe that AI purpose-built for medicine will define the next century of healthcare, you belong at Corti.

The Role

As a Staff Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with product teams. The R&D group includes experienced engineers, Ph.D. students, and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

In this role, you’ll help develop new models, implement state-of-the-art research, and contribute to translating those outputs into impactful product features. For example, you might support prototyping a new ML-based product feature in collaboration with other teams, or work on adapting cutting-edge research to Corti’s healthcare domain.

What You’ll Be Doing


Contribute to building and improving machine learning models for audio, text, and structured data.
Translate research outcomes into prototypes that can inform new product features.
Help design and implement APIs and pipelines that make ML models accessible across the organization.
Collaborate with researchers, engineers, and product teams to move ML ideas into production.
Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.


What You Bring


A Master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Mastery in Python, data structures, and algorithms, with the ability to contribute to production-level code.
Experience with at least one major ML framework (PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Practical experience working on applied machine learning projects (academic or industry).
Strong communication skills—you can explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical colleagues.
Experience with natural language processing, speech recognition, or generative AI.
Familiarity with designing ML pipelines for real-world applications.
Contributions to research projects, publications, or open-source work.


Life at Corti


You will be reporting to the Director of Engineering
The position is full-time and starts as soon as possible.
Hybrid working environment in our Copenhagen Office
Equipment provided by Corti


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

🤝 Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.﻿

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we’re passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we’re looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you’ll consider applying!

Title: Senior Software Engineer with a passion for Data processing
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For our client, a large Danish Retail company, Bloom is looking for an exceptionally gifted Senior Software Engineer to become one of the leading minds behind the company´s future data ecosystem.




Do you want to build an enterprise ready data platform to power the company´s data using cutting-edge technology? Making your mark on platform engineering, you will supply fellow engineers with robust data processing applications, reliable infrastructure and smooth software tooling.




Powering the data analytics and AI use-cases you will also enable business units to make data-driven decisions. The team is highly motivated, collaborative, and fun-loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore and innovate, they are tackling an endless range of exiting new opportunities.

Job profile

You will join highly skilled and seasoned colleagues on the Platform Engineering team in the Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen. They lead the entire enterprise data platform initiatives and capabilities and drive an ambitious strategy to fundamentally improve how the whole Organization operates based on data.




As a Senior SW Engineer, you are contributing with your technical expertise and strong development skills to the success of the company´s enterprise data platform and the use-cases it powers.




In this role, you will:

▪ Develop crucial pieces of the infrastructure with reliability, security, and scalability in mind

▪ Deploy and maintain systems that store and process data

▪ Debug complex system behaviour under high load and devise as well as implement strategies for failure mitigation

▪ Operate the data platform, identify maintenance needs ahead of time and address them

▪ Expand the data platform by identifying and assessing workflows and systems that your colleagues can use advantageously for their work with data

▪ Assess load and plan capacity for production systems

▪ Exchange frequently ideas with colleagues to align on implementation as well as architecture choices

▪ Set-up the data platform for an ambitious roadmap within the company




Personal profile

You are ambitious, self-driven and resourceful. Developing solutions within a team and tackling challenges drives you. With your creative can-do mindset and strong problem-solving skills, you can find opportunities for improving the existing platform, test the effectiveness of different implementations and courses of action.




We imagine that you:

▪ Hold a Master´s Degree, PhD within science and engineering, e.g. computer science, software engineering or electrical engineering

▪ Have senior-level experience from a similar position using two or three programming languages, preferably Go, Rust or Scala

▪ Have significant experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) preferably using Terraform

▪ Have solid understanding of virtualization and containerization under GNU/Linux

▪ Demonstrate deep understanding of Kubernetes and its concept

▪ Demonstrate deep understanding of SQL and its use in large-scale analytics unified engines

▪ Demonstrate strong data and metadata modelling skills and familiarity with standard frameworks, such as Kimball Lifecycle Methodology

▪ Have experience using DataOps and Data Observability principles in practice and operations

▪ Exhibit strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to reason about complex data engineering and modelling challenges

▪ Train and mentor lower-level engineers on best practices

▪ Have excellent communication skills and proficiency in English




The company offers

A challenging and varied job in an international organization that is constantly developing. The company is characterized by an informal environment, and they highly value cooperation, initiative and new ideas.




Your continued personal and professional development is essential, and you will participate in internal and external courses, education and conferences supporting this constant development. The company offers an appealing compensation package incl. pension scheme, health and casualty insurance, home office; Internet, mobile phone/subscription as well as 5+1-week vacation, discounts, social gatherings and much more…




Practical Information

This is an international organization with many nationalities in many countries. They aim at reflecting the same multicultural environment in their local offices. All qualified applications are therefore very welcome, regardless of nationality, religion, gender, age, or ethnical background.




Bloom is handling the recruitment for this position. For more information, please contact, Senior Consultant, Kristine Heuser at kh@bloom.dk

Please send your application and CV as soon as possible – Applications will be screened on an ongoing basis.

Title: Staff Machine Learning Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

The AI Agents org is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that is pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

We are delighted to be hiring a Staff Machine Learning Scientist for the AI Agent product at Zendesk. This is an exciting opportunity for a senior-level leader to not only bridge the gap between cutting-edge ML research and real-world impact but to actively define that bridge. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our product vision through bottom-up innovation, rapid prototyping, and the establishment of best practices. You'll have the freedom to discover and champion new product ideas, mentor junior scientists, and work alongside a talented cross-functional team to build the world’s most advanced AI agents in CX.

Key Responsibilities


Pioneer Product Vision and Innovation: You will partner closely with product managers and other stakeholders to discover and define the product roadmap. You'll champion bottom-up innovation, bringing forward novel ideas and research to influence the team's strategic direction.
Lead Rapid Prototyping: You will own the full research and development lifecycle from end-to-end, translating business requirements into technical designs. This includes the rapid implementation and testing of hypotheses using suitable tools and technologies to quickly validate solutions for future production.
Standardize Research and Evaluation: You will establish and evangelize research standards and best practices for the evaluation of our AI agents, ensuring consistency and rigor in how we measure success.
Mentor and Enable the Team: You will act as a force multiplier, mentoring other scientists and engineers, and enabling them to tackle complex challenges. You will also help non-technical stakeholders, like Product Managers, better understand the technical landscape.
Drive End-to-End Projects: You will own complex, designated product areas, guiding the team through the full research project lifecycle, from initial ideation to implementation, experimentation, and reporting.
Stay at the Forefront of Research: You will keep up with the latest advancements in the NLP and ML fields, introducing new concepts and literature as potential solutions to our business problems.
Collaborate and Peer Review: You will regularly discuss and peer-review research ideas with your colleagues, contributing to a culture of shared learning and continuous improvement.


Who You Are


A Proven Innovator: You have a strong track record of Machine Learning or NLP research, ideally in a senior industry role. You are known for not just solving problems, but for identifying and framing them.
Expert in Deep Learning: You have deep knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, with a focus on NLP. You can implement complex ideas from research literature into robust proof-of-concept models.
Experienced with Generative AI: You have significant experience with LLMs, Prompt Engineering, and AI Agent Context Management. Experience with conversational AI and voice technologies, including text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS), is a huge bonus.
A Collaborative Leader: You have a positive, proactive, and team-oriented mindset. You are passionate about your craft and are keen to take part in product discussions. You care deeply about helping others succeed and have great communication skills.
The Right Qualifications: You hold a degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.


How We Measure Success


Strategic Impact: Your work directly influences and aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
Mentorship and Team Growth: Your ability to mentor and enable others demonstrably improves the team's capabilities and output.
Bottom-Up Innovation: Your ability to identify new opportunities and champion these ideas leads to tangible improvements in our products.
Research Standardization: The research evaluation frameworks you establish are widely adopted and improve the quality and rigor of our work.
Collaboration: Your effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders helps bridge technical and non-technical gaps.


The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:


Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
Take-home technical/research challenge
A technical interview with two of our scientists to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
Final interview with 2 Engineering Managers - 45 minutes


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

Hybrid: In this role, our hybrid experience is designed at the team level to give you a rich onsite experience packed with connection, collaboration, learning, and celebration - while also giving you flexibility to work remotely for part of the week. This role must attend our local office for part of the week. The specific in-office schedule is to be determined by the hiring manager.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

As part of our commitment to fairness and transparency, we inform all applicants that artificial intelligence (AI) or automated decision systems may be used to screen or evaluate applications for this position, in accordance with Company guidelines and applicable law.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Technology Graduate
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Join a world of energy as Technology Graduate with MFT Energy

In MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. As a Technology Graduate you will join a company where energy is more than just a commodity, it’s in our people, our ambitions, and the way we work every day.

The Graduate Program

Our Graduate Program stands out for its flexibility and tailored approach, ensuring that your graduate journey is personalized to your ambitions and skills. It is a 2-year program with 3 rotations: all focused on giving you hands-on experience and insights into how technology shapes and influences energy trading in MFT Energy. From day one, you’ll collaborate with experts, work on impactful projects, and be given autonomy to make a difference.

As An MFT Graduate, You Will Experience


A personalized program that gives you the autonomy to influence your career
An ambitious development plan, ensuring you make the most of your talent
A personal mentor and a strong graduate community
The opportunity to work from on of our abroad offices


Learn more about our graduate program here.

The Technology Track

In the technology track, you’ll help shape the platforms and systems that fuel every trade we make. We use data and tech to drive every decision and every trade.

As a Technology Graduate, You Will Experience


Collaborative Development: We build in close collaboration with our users. You will work side-by-side with the business, using agile ways of working and fast feedback-loops to build smart solutions that deliver real value.
Focus on Innovation and Technical Excellence: We’re serious about clean code and staying ahead of tech trends. We encourage our developers to test new technologies, methods, and frameworks that could give MFT Energy an edge in the market. Our current tech stack is focused on C#, REACT, MSSQL, Python, Rust, and TypeScript.
Learning-driven culture: We’re committed to your growth, both personal and professional. Our culture is focused on continuous improvement and knowledge sharing, making sure we are always improving. You will have experienced and supportive colleagues to mentor and guide you.
Turn complex data into usable insights: Be part of developing tools that translate billions of data points into actionable knowledge, fueling the decisions behind every trade.


By the end of the program, you’ll be well-prepared to build and scale the technologies and data platforms that keep MFT Energy competitive.

About You

You’re passionate about data and technology – not just the code itself, but how it can solve real problems and create meaningful impact. You’re curious by nature, eager to learn, and motivated by the idea of becoming an expert in your field. You're self-driven and take ownership of your own development. You actively seek opportunities to grow, challenge yourself, and shape your career path. You thrive when given responsibility, and you’re excited about working closely with others to create solutions that push the business forward. You have a proactive communication approach when collaborating with stakeholders and understand that unity is the key to success.

Moreover, You


Have completed a Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, or a related field in 2025 or 2026
Might have experience with software development and contributing to open-source projects
Are fluent in English, both spoken and written, as it is our corporate language


Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you are ready to make the most of your talent in MFT Energy, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a cover letter, grades, and CV. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Application deadline: January 11, 2026

First interviews: Mid-end January 2026

Graduate meet-up (for applicants in Denmark): February 05, 2026

Second interviews: Mid February 2026

Start date: September 01, 2026.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. We believe that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.

  • Expert in Deep Learning: You have deep knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, with a focus on NLP. You can implement complex ideas from research literature into robust proof-of-concept models.
  • Experienced with Generative AI: You have significant experience with LLMs, Prompt Engineering, and AI Agent Context Management. Experience with conversational AI and voice technologies, including text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS), is a huge bonus.
  • A Collaborative Leader: You have a positive, proactive, and team-oriented mindset. You are passionate about your craft and are keen to take part in product discussions. You care deeply about helping others succeed and have great communication skills.
  • The Right Qualifications: You hold a degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.

How We Measure Success

  • Strategic Impact: Your work directly influences and aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
  • Mentorship and Team Growth: Your ability to mentor and enable others demonstrably improves the team's capabilities and output.
  • Bottom-Up Innovation: Your ability to identify new opportunities and champion these ideas leads to tangible improvements in our products.
  • Research Standardization: The research evaluation frameworks you establish are widely adopted and improve the quality and rigor of our work.
  • Collaboration: Your effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders helps bridge technical and non-technical gaps.

The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:

  • Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
  • Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
  • Take-home technical/research challenge
  • A technical interview with two of our scientists to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
  • Final interview with 2 Engineering Managers - 45 minutes

About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

Hybrid: In this role, our hybrid experience is designed at the team level to give you a rich onsite experience packed with connection, collaboration, learning, and celebration - while also giving you flexibility to work remotely for part of the week. This role must attend our local office for part of the week. The specific in-office schedule is to be determined by the hiring manager.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

As part of our commitment to fairness and transparency, we inform all applicants that artificial intelligence (AI) or automated decision systems may be used to screen or evaluate applications for this position, in accordance with Company guidelines and applicable law.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: AI Engineer Consultant
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Introduction

Vil du hjælpe nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder med at realisere potentialet for AI? Vi søger en ambitiøs AI Engineer til vores konsulentteam, der brænder for at arbejde med både traditionel data science og GenAI.

IBM Client Innovation Center er en konsulent- og leveranceenhed i IBM-koncernen, hvor vi leverer industrispecifik ekspertise og udvikling af ny teknologi. Vi tilbyder vores kunder dyb teknisk ekspertise og lokal forankring i at drive innovation og adoption af ny teknologi.

Your Role And Responsibilities

Som AI Engineer hos os bliver du en del af et stærkt fagligt miljø, hvor vi hjælper kunderne med at løfte deres tekniske fundament og skabe håndgribelig værdi gennem AI. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med kunderne om at designe og implementere løsninger, der spænder fra Databricks pipelines, ML- og AI-modeller og LLM basserede agent løsninger.

Vi arbejder typisk på længerevarende projekter (1–3 år), men der kan også være kortere engagementer, hvor vi hurtigt skifter branche eller teknologi. Derfor vil du både få dybde og bredde i din rolle – og en stejl læringskurve.

Dine Opgaver Vil Bl.a. Være At


Arbejde med de nyeste teknologier indenfor AI og GenAI
Udvikle og operationalisere ML- og AI-modeller i produktion
Udnytte LLM’er, RAG og Copilot-teknologier til intelligente applikationer
Indgå i tæt samarbejde med kunderne og omsætte forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger


Vi tilbyder

IBM er verdensledende inden for teknologi, konsulentydelser og innovation – og et fantastisk sted at udvikle sig, både fagligt og personligt. Her får du muligheder for at opbygge et globalt netværk og lære af stjerner i branchen som mentorer.

Desuden Tilbyder Vi


Et miljø, hvor vi kombinerer faglighed på højt niveau med et stærkt socialt fællesskab
Adgang til stort set al den træning og certificering du kan ønske dig
Projekter, der giver dig variation, udfordringer og ansvar fra dag ét
Et team og en ledelse der værdsætter både mening og arbejdsglæde
Fleksibilitet og frihed under ansvar i et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø
Vi holder til på Aarhus Ø og hos kunderne


Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Data & Analytics Practice Lead, Mikkel Buchvardt på Mikkel.B-CIC@ibm.com. Vi ser frem til at modtage dit CV!

Preferred Education

None

Required Technical And Professional Expertise

For at blive en succes i denne rolle kunne du f.eks. have:


Erfaring inden for data engineering/science/AI (gerne 1–3 år) – eller en stærk profil på vej mod seniorniveau
Forståelse for ML, DL, AI, GenAI og Agentic AI
Stærke kompetencer i Python og SQL og praktisk erfaring med Azure Data og AI Platforme
Kendskab til eller erfaring med Databricks
Gode kommunikationsevner, lyst til at arbejde tæt med kunder og ser kontinuerlig læring og udvikling inden for dit fagområde som en nødvendighed


Vi arbejder primært med lokale kunder i Danmark, hvorfor vi forventer, at du kan begå dig professionelt på både dansk og engelsk.
Show more

Title: Lead Engineer - Identity Lifecycle & Access Governance
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Ready to build the future of secure, seamless access at the LEGO Group? We’re looking for a Lead Engineer to drive our Identity Lifecycle Management strategy, implement modern access control models, and lead the deployment of a scalable policy engine platform supporting our future business requirements.

Join the LEGO® Digital team and have a blast enabling colleagues globally to compose new business values with the latest digital technologies – and have a little fun while doing it!


Core Responsibilities.

Our new Lead Engineer will be responsible for designing and delivering robust identity lifecycle solutions that support our security model. Govern the implementation of Role-Based (RBAC), Attribute-Based (ABAC), and Policy-Based Access Control (PBAC) frameworks, and orchestrate the rollout of a Policy Engine platform to enable multifaceted, scalable governance.

The role has the responsibility as the Product Owner for the LEGO Group’s Identity and Access Management (IAM) technologies. This involves advocating for your team and your Product, driving teamwork across the wider Colleague Enablement and Digital Technology landscape.





Set directions for the product by crafting a product vision, roadmap, defining Objectives and Key Results, and setting clear operational priorities.
As a member of the Colleague Enablement Leadership Team, advocate for your own product while also strategically aligning and collaborating with your peers to drive the evolution of the experience we collectively deliver for all LEGO Group Colleagues.
Lead the deployment of an enterprise-grade Policy Engine platform for policy enforcement.
Ensure compliance with internal and external audit requirements through automated controls and reporting.
Architect and implement identity lifecycle workflows across joiner/mover/leaver processes.
Build and govern scalable access models using RBAC, ABAC, and PBAC.
Drive innovation in self-service access provisioning and adaptive authentication.
Mentor and guide engineers in secure development principles and IAM standard processes.
Collaborate multi-functionally with engineering, security, and business teams to align access governance with operational needs.




Play your part in our team succeeding.

Join a dynamic team leading full-stack Identity and Access Control. We support the LEGO Group colleagues with password-less sign-in, adaptive multifactor authentication, and privileged account management, including custom-built APIs for developers. Our mission is to compose a centralized, automated platform for identity, access, and authorization, adopting a Zero Trust security model. Your leadership will be valuable to the team's success.

The team is experienced, diverse and based in the LEGO® Campus headquarters in Billund. The work environment is inclusive, energizing, autonomous, and flexible.

Do you have what it takes?

We are looking for an experienced candidate, ideally with a consistent track record of leading a team responsible for an organization’s core foundational identity solutions.

We would also consider strong senior engineering talent looking to take their next step, with the ambition to drive the future of these technologies.

It is encouraged that you would bring to the role





A solid grasp and experience with Microsoft Active Directory and Entra ID, and associated technologies
Experience crafting and building APIs.
Proficiency in modern authentication methods.
Good interpersonal and collaboration skills to take on a technical mentoring role at the helm of a strong established team and be a great teammate who enjoys incorporating fun into everyday work.
Experience liaising with vendors to drive product roadmap development in support of an organization’s goals




Advanced English both written and verbally are needed since we are an international gathered team.

Please note If you require any reasonable accommodation or adjustments throughout the application process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

This position is Senior Manager Skyline. Relocation support is not offered.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Title: Scientific Data Engineer - EMEA
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
TetraScience is a Scientific Data and AI company with a mission to radically improve and extend human life. TetraScience combines the world's only open, purpose-built, and collaborative scientific data and AI cloud with deep scientific expertise across the value chain to accelerate and improve scientific outcomes. TetraScience is catalyzing the Scientific AI revolution by designing and industrializing AI-native scientific data sets, which it brings to life in a growing suite of next generation lab data management products, scientific use cases, and AI-based outcomes

Our core values are designed to guide our behaviors, actions, and decisions such that we operate as one. We are looking to add high-performance team members that authentically and unconditionally embrace our values:


Transparency and Context - We trust our people will make the right decisions and overcome any challenges when given data and context
Trust and Collaboration - We believe there can only be trust when there is transparency. We are committed to always communicating openly and honestly
Fearlessness and Resilience - We proactively run toward challenges of all types. We embrace uncertainty and we take calculated risks
Alignment with Customers - We are completely committed to ensuring our customers and partners achieve their missions and treat them with respect and humility
Commitment to Craft - We are passionate missionaries. We sweat the details, as the small things enable the big things
Equality of Opportunity - We seek out the best of the best regardless of gender, ethnicity, race, or age; We seek out those who embody our common values but bring unique and invaluable perspectives, talents, and advantages


What You Will Do

You will be a Senior member of the Scientific Data Engineer team and helping build Tetra Data and productizable solutions, which is the foundation of the Data Engineering layer. We are looking for a player-coach data engineer who is experienced, hands-on, and can also provide mentorship to junior team members. As a Senior Scientific Data Engineer, you should be comfortable leading internal design sessions and architecting solutions. You will work directly with Product Managers and Solution Architects to gather business and data design objectives, resulting in production-based solutions. As a Senior Scientific Data Engineer, you will be a team-focused leader, have excellent data engineering skills, supervise and collaborate on project executions, and have a high commitment to customer success by delivering mission-critical implementations.

Our success is defined by collaboration. You will have tremendous support to achieve your objectives, from a variety of teams, both internal and external.


Work with Product Managers and Solution Architects to understand business requirements, gather insight into potential positive outcomes, recommend potential outcomes, and build a solution based on consensus
Take ownership of building data models, prototypes, and integration solutions that drive customer success
Research and prototype data integration strategy for scientific lab instrumentation, prototype file parsers for instrument output files (.xlsx, .pdf, .txt, .raw, .fid, and many other vendor binaries)
Quality gatekeeper: design with quality backed by unit tests, integration tests, and utility functions
Lead team-wide process/technology improvements on product quality and developer experience
Rally the team to finish Agile Sprint commitments. Actively surfacing team inefficiencies and striving to resolve them
Driven by results. Have the pragmatic urgency to resolve blockers, unclear requirements, and make things happen
Provide mentorship to junior SDEs and show leadership in every front


Requirements


Experience in Life Sciences and scientific data - ideally, direct wet lab experience or at least with supporting scientists
4+ years of building solutions as a Data Engineer or similar fields
4+ years working in Python and SQL with a focus on data
4+ years of experience leading projects, managing requirements, and handling timelines
4+ years of experience managing multiple customer-focused implementation projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes, and managing delivery milestones
Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and the confidence to take control of project delivery
Quickly understand a highly technical product and effectively communicate with product management and engineering


Benefits


100% employer paid benefits for all eligible employees and immediate family members
401K
Unlimited paid time off (PTO)
Flexible working arrangements
Company paid Life Insurance, LTD/STD
Show more

Title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Coalesce Management Consultancy (CMC) have a consulting assignment available for a Senior Embedded Software Engineering Consultant, to work on a project we have in Copenhagen, Denmark.




CMC provide expert engineering solutions on an international capacity for Embedded systems and other Advanced Engineering projects. Established in 2016, we set out our mission to be the best service-driven consulting business in global STEM markets, and after rapid growth in just a few years, we’re already delivering true expertise to major technology brands and leading companies around the world.




As we expand our reach and take on new projects, we have assignments available for experienced professionals to join our consultancy and deliver the expert solutions and high level of service we’re known for across multiple ventures.




By partnering with CMC, you get the chance to work with some of the world’s leading technology specialists. From our global offices we support you with each new project, providing a complete scope of work definition ahead of any engagement, so you know exactly what’s required by the assignment, before you land on-site. As the project is completed, we can continue to work with you by setting up your next project from our global network of leading technology companies.




Join our latest project




We’re looking to support one of our project teams with a Senior Embedded Software Engineer for an exciting new assignment in Denmark.

In this position, you’ll be responsible for design, implementation, and validation of embedded software solutions across a range of advanced applications. You’ll work closely with multidisciplinary engineering teams, combining technical leadership with hands-on delivery to help bring cutting-edge technology to market.




The main requirements would be:




5+ years of experience developing embedded software in C/C++ for microcontrollers (such as STM32, ESP32, or other ARM Cortex-based platforms) and RTOS environments (such as FreeRTOS, ZephyrOS, ThreadX, or VxWorks).




Proven ability to design, implement, and debug communication protocols and device interfaces (for example, CAN, SPI, I²C, UART, Modbus, or BLE — experience with similar protocols is equally valued).




Skilled in system integration and cross-functional collaboration with hardware and test teams (e.g., debugging bring-up issues, validating sensor data chains, or supporting production testing).




Demonstrated background in optimising embedded software for performance, reliability, and scalability (e.g., improving interrupt handling, reducing memory footprint, refining task scheduling).




Experienced in defining and validating embedded architectures within complex or distributed systems (e.g., multi-board or IoT environments, safety-critical control systems).




Knowledge of industry standards and compliance frameworks (e.g., MISRA C/C++, ISO 26262, IEC 61508, ISO 13485 — familiarity with comparable standards is also acceptable).




Comfortable working as a consultant, with strong ownership, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills (e.g., leading technical reviews or mentoring client teams).







You would be required to operate as an independent consultant for this assignment, which I can support you with. On-site presence in Denmark will be required.




If you have the relevant capability and are interested in pursuing this assignment, talk to our sales consultants today. finlay.gethin@cmcexpertisedelivered.com







Get in touch




Learn more about Coalesce Management Consulting, our projects and the support we provide to our consultants at https://expertisedelivered.com







No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Graduate Software Engineer (2025)
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
IMC is launching a new power and gas trading business in Aarhus, Denmark – the European hub for energy trading. We are building a strong, independent, Aarhus-based team with local leadership, backed by more than 30 years of IMC’s global trading expertise.

As a Graduate Software Engineer in Aarhus, you’ll have the unique opportunity to help build a brand-new technology stack that supports all aspects of energy trading – from exchange connectivity and pricing to trading algorithms and real-time data analysis. You’ll grow rapidly through our global graduate program while contributing from day one to this exciting new venture.

Your IMC Journey

In your first year, you will join a five-week Global Trainee Program alongside graduates from our offices in Europe, the US, and Asia-Pacific. Led by experienced engineers and traders, this immersive program will introduce you to the world of trading, financial markets, and production-grade software development. You’ll dive deep into software craftsmanship, programming, and the systems that power our trading operations.

Back in our Aarhus office, you’ll join the Energy Trading team — a highly collaborative environment where you’ll help design real-time systems, process large volumes of data, and solve complex engineering challenges that directly impact the markets.

At IMC, innovation is at our core. We continuously invest in R&D and adapt quickly to evolving markets. We also invest in you — offering extensive training, mentorship, and global exposure to help you grow fast in a high-impact environment.

Your Core Responsibilities


Design and build high-performance technology that supports energy trading
Work on the full software development lifecycle, from idea to deployment
Develop real-time pricing and trading systems, exchange connectivity, and analytics tools
Collaborate closely with traders, researchers, and other engineers
Be part of a new local team in Aarhus and shape its growth and culture


What You’ll Bring


You are in your final year of a Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related degree, and graduating in 2025
Strong programming skills in C++/Python/Java
Solid understanding of algorithms and data structures
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
A genuine interest in financial markets (no prior knowledge required)
Full professional fluency in English
You’re excited by the opportunity to shape a new business and build innovative systems from the ground up


Please Note

IMC’s graduate traineeship includes international travel to the US. Due to current visa processing challenges, we are unable to proceed with applications from candidates who only hold citizenship from Russia, Belarus, Iran, or Ukraine. If you hold dual citizenship from another country, please inform our campus recruitment team at CampusEU@imc.com.

About Us

IMC is a global trading firm powered by a cutting-edge research environment and a world-class technology backbone. Since 1989, we’ve been a stabilizing force in financial markets, providing essential liquidity upon which market participants depend. Across our offices in the US, Europe, Asia Pacific, and India, our talented quant researchers, engineers, traders, and business operations professionals are united by our uniquely collaborative, high-performance culture, and our commitment to giving back. From entering dynamic new markets to embracing disruptive technologies, and from developing an innovative research environment to diversifying our trading strategies, we dare to continuously innovate and collaborate to succeed.

Title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Bioinformatics
Company: LEO Foundation Skin Immunology Research Center (SIC)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job portal
Faculty and academic p...


Postdoctoral Fellow in Bioinformatics

Are you a bioinformatician passionate about applying your skills to uncover the molecular underpinnings of human disease? We are seeking a highly motivated Postdoctoral Fellow to join the Cardiac Proteomics & Systems Biology Group at the University of Copenhagen. This position offers a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of proteomics, clinical data integration, and AI-based image analysis to explore molecular phenotypes of cardiac disease.

About The Project

You will lead the analysis of a large-scale mass spectrometry-based proteomics dataset derived from archival FFPE-preserved cardiac tissue samples from a well-characterized patient cohort. Your work will focus on identifying molecular profiles associated with distinct cardiac disease presentations.

In addition to proteomics data, you will have access to clinical metadata for integrative analysis and histological images (HE-stained sections) from the same heart samples, enabling exploration of AI-driven image analysis approaches.

Your Key Responsibilities


Perform high-quality downstream analysis of DDA/DIA LC-MS/MS proteomics data
Integrate clinical parameters with molecular data to identify disease-associated signatures
Apply or develop AI-based methods for histological image analysis (optional but encouraged)
Conduct multi-modal data integration to define molecular phenotypes of cardiac disease
Contribute to manuscript writing and dissemination of findings
Collaborate with team members and support junior researchers in data analysis


Your Profile

We are looking for a creative and driven scientist with a strong background in bioinformatics and a keen interest in translational cardiovascular research.

Essential Qualifications


PhD in bioinformatics, computational biology, systems biology, or a related field
Proven experience in analyzing mass spectrometry-based proteomics data (DDA/DIA)
Familiarity with software frameworks such as DIA-NN, FragPipe, or comparable platforms
Strong programming skills in Python and/or R, and solid understanding of statistical data analysis
Experience integrating clinical or multi-omics datasets
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
At least one first-author publication in a relevant field
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team


Desirable Qualifications


Familiarity with AI-based image analysis (e.g., deep learning for histology)
Background in cardiac biology or related biomedical fields
Experience with FFPE sample data or histopathological datasets


The preferred applicant should have an excellent academic track record, solid research experience and be highly motivated to deploy diverse strategies to extract novel findings of importance to pathophysiology. Previous research experience in an ambitious research environment is required.

Our group and environment

The candidate will be part of the Cardiac Proteomics and Systems Biology group led by Professor Lundby at the Department of Biomedical Sciences at the University of Copenhagen, Denmark. The successful candidate will be working in a team of scientists across multiple scientific fields focused on improving our molecular understanding of cardiac pathophysiology. Our facilities include state-of-the-art laboratories and core facilities as well as modern office spaces. The position provides a unique opportunity to develop expertise in cutting edge quantitative mass spectrometry-based proteomics, data analysis of large datasets and integration of multi-omics datasets. Striving for academic excellence, collegial respect and freedom tempered by responsibility, we offer creative, friendly and stimulating working conditions in a dynamic and strong scientific environment.

Salary and terms of employment

Salary, pension and terms of employment will be in accordance with the agreement between the Danish Ministry of Taxation and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations). Depending on qualifications, a supplement may be negotiated.

Non-Danish and Danish applicants may be eligible for tax reductions if they hold a PhD degree and have not lived in Denmark for the past 10 years.

The position is covered by the Job Structure for Academic Staff at Universities 2025.

Workplace and period of employment

Workplace is located at Maersk Tower, The Panum Institute, University of Copenhagen, Denmark. The period of employment is 3 years. Suggested start date is March 1, 2026, or soon thereafter.

Further information

Further information may be obtained from Professor Lundby: alicia.lundby@sund.ku.dk.

You can read more about Cardiac Proteomics Group at www.lundbylab.com

You can read more about the Department of Biomedical Sciences at www.bmi.ku.dk

Application procedure

Interested candidates are encouraged to submit an online application by clicking “APPLY NOW” below no later than December 7, 23:59 pm CET.

The File Must Include

Applications Must Be Submitted As PDF File Containing All Materials To Be Given Consideration. Attach All Your Materials In English In PDF File. The Application Should Contain


Application (cover letter)
CV
Relevant diplomas (incl official translation into English, if in other languages than Danish or English).
List of publications
Contact details for two referees


Applications and enclosures received after the deadline will not be considered.

After the expiry of the deadline for applications, the authorized recruitment manager selects applicants for assessment on the advice of the Appointments Committee. All applicants are then immediately notified whether their application has been passed for assessment by an expert assessment committee. Selected applicants are notified of the composition of the committee and each applicant has the opportunity to comment on the part of the assessment that relates to the applicant him/herself. You can read about the recruitment process at www.employment.ku.dk

The University of Copenhagen wish to reflect the diversity of society and encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of personal background.

The Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences comprises approximately 7500 students, 1500 PhD students and 3200 employees. The Faculty advances the field of health sciences through its core activities: research, teaching, knowledge sharing and communication. With basic research fields ranging from molecular studies to studies of society, the Faculty contributes to a healthy future through its graduates, research findings and inventions benefitting patients and the community.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Alicia Lundby

E-mail: hpd299@ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 07-12-2025

Employment start: 01-03-2026

Working hours: Full time

Department/Location: Department of Biomedical Sciences

Title: Part time - Backend Developer - AI Startup (Remote - Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Savery is recruiting a part-time backend developer with strong capabilities in building and maintaining robust backend systems utilising LLMs to support our core product. As a backend developer, you will lead the coding of the Savery Agentic Management tool.

This is initially a part-time, remote role with the flexibility to work from Copenhagen should you wish so. If you require a on-location job, you will not be considered for the position.

About You

You are an experienced problem solver with a passion for backend development and a growth mindset. As an expert in Python, you have a deep understanding of FastAPI and experience working with managed services like Google Cloud, AWS, and Azure. You excel in designing, developing, and maintaining efficient database architectures, and you have a proven track record of identifying and resolving complex technical issues.

You thrive on ownership, taking the lead in designing and implementing solutions that ensure scalability, reliability, and efficiency. Your proactive approach and commitment to excellence will be vital in maintaining the high standards of Savery’s platform.

Role Overview

We are seeking a lead Backend Developer to join Savery and contribute to the technical backbone of Savery’s innovative platform. LLM expertise is a requirement, and a deep interest in LLMs and understanding of sophisticated LLM prompt engineering is an added strength.

Responsibilities


Build and optimize backend systems to power Savery’s core platform.
Develop scalable, secure cloud infrastructure using Google Cloud
Design and implement efficient backend services and APIs with Python and FastAPI.
Automate infrastructure deployments with Terraform.
Work on database design with a focus on performance and scalability.
Work closely with I engineers to integrate backend systems with LLM functionalities.
Debug and resolve technical challenges to ensure platform reliability.


Requirements


Proven experience developing with Python.
Solid experience of one or more cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, or Azure).
Experience with FastAPI for building APIs.
Proficiency with Terraform for infrastructure as code.
Hands-on experience with Docker for containerized application deployment.
Strong understanding of database design.
Interest in LLM technologies and enthusiasm for learning more about their applications.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment.


What We’re Looking For


A skilled backend developer motivated to work on technical infrastructure and solve complex challenges.
Someone driven by opportunities to build in the rapid eveolving agentic LLM industry.
You properly have a masters degree in software development or computer science and some years of experience.


Why Join Savery?


Be part of a venture-backed startup with opportunities to directly impact its success.
Direct access on shaping the platform’s future.
Opportunities for career growth, including increased responsibilities as the company scales.


Savery does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies. Please refrain from forwarding resumes to our job postings, team members, or any other Savery office or contact. Savery is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.
