Title: Creative AI Specialist (Image, Video & 3D)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company description:

VirtuallPRO is the workspace for AI-powered creative production, built in Europe and trusted by global design, retail, game, and VFX teams. We unify safe and compliant 3D, image, and video generation so creative teams can adopt AI with confidence.




Role Description

We’re looking for a Creative AI Specialist who knows how to push AI models to their limits. Someone who loves tweaking settings, prompts, workarounds, and small production details to make AI-generated content reach the 100% quality level our customers expect.

This role sits at the intersection of content creation, AI model knowledge, and creative problem-solving, working closely with brands in retail, gaming, furniture, architecture, lifestyle and more.




Responsibilities:

Fine-tune and optimize AI generations (image, video, 3D) to meet enterprise-level quality standards.
Adjust prompts, model settings, seeds, and advanced parameters to get consistent, high-quality outputs.
Use pre- and post-production workarounds to fix details and close the last 10–20% gap between AI output and customer expectations.
Test and evaluate the newest AI models across the market (image, video, 3D).
Build repeatable workflows that teams can use for generating content at scale.
Collaborate with retail, gaming, architecture, and creative teams on real brand use cases.
Document best practices, prompt templates, and quality guidelines.
Identify limitations of models and create practical solutions to overcome them.




Qualifications

Strong understanding of how different creative AI models behave
Experience in creative production: image editing, film post-production, 3D workflows, or marketing content creation.
Natural curiosity, you love experimenting with new models, settings, and hacks.
Process-driven mindset: you enjoy building clean and repeatable workflows.
Strong eye for visual quality, composition, lighting, and realism.
Ability to work across industries with different quality and brand expectations.
Comfortable collaborating with customers and translating their needs into concrete AI solutions.




What you can expect:

You’ll work at the forefront of a fast-moving industry where new models, tools, and creative possibilities emerge every week.
You’ll help define real production workflows for global brands adopting Creative AI at scale.
You’ll join a team building one of the most flexible and enterprise-ready Creative AI platforms in Europe.
Your work will directly shape how the next generation of images, videos, and 3D assets are produced.




Show more
HTML:
Company description:

VirtuallPRO is the workspace for AI-powered creative production, built in Europe and trusted by global design, retail, game, and VFX teams. We unify safe and compliant 3D, image, and video generation so creative teams can adopt AI with confidence.


Role Description

We’re looking for a Creative AI Specialist who knows how to push AI models to their limits. Someone who loves tweaking settings, prompts, workarounds, and small production details to make AI-generated content reach the 100% quality level our customers expect.

This role sits at the intersection of content creation, AI model knowledge, and creative problem-solving, working closely with brands in retail, gaming, furniture, architecture, lifestyle and more.


Responsibilities:

  • Fine-tune and optimize AI generations (image, video, 3D) to meet enterprise-level quality standards.
  • Adjust prompts, model settings, seeds, and advanced parameters to get consistent, high-quality outputs.
  • Use pre- and post-production workarounds to fix details and close the last 10–20% gap between AI output and customer expectations.
  • Test and evaluate the newest AI models across the market (image, video, 3D).
  • Build repeatable workflows that teams can use for generating content at scale.
  • Collaborate with retail, gaming, architecture, and creative teams on real brand use cases.
  • Document best practices, prompt templates, and quality guidelines.
  • Identify limitations of models and create practical solutions to overcome them.


Qualifications

  • Strong understanding of how different creative AI models behave
  • Experience in creative production: image editing, film post-production, 3D workflows, or marketing content creation.
  • Natural curiosity, you love experimenting with new models, settings, and hacks.
  • Process-driven mindset: you enjoy building clean and repeatable workflows.
  • Strong eye for visual quality, composition, lighting, and realism.
  • Ability to work across industries with different quality and brand expectations.
  • Comfortable collaborating with customers and translating their needs into concrete AI solutions.


What you can expect:

  • You’ll work at the forefront of a fast-moving industry where new models, tools, and creative possibilities emerge every week.
  • You’ll help define real production workflows for global brands adopting Creative AI at scale.
  • You’ll join a team building one of the most flexible and enterprise-ready Creative AI platforms in Europe.
  • Your work will directly shape how the next generation of images, videos, and 3D assets are produced.

Title: Paid Search Specialist
Place: Helsingør, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Will you be Cheffelo’s new Paid Search Specialist? Set the direction for digital visibility in the Nordics’ leading FoodTech company!

🌱 Why join the Cheffelo journey?

Cheffelo is the Nordics’ leading and most profitable meal kit provider, helping people eat well without the stress of planning and shopping. Since 2008, we’ve made it easier to enjoy varied, nutritious home-cooked meals through tailored meal kits with minimal food waste. With nearly 400 engaged employees, we manage our own production facilities, develop smart technology, and deliver unique customer experiences. The company operates under the brands Linas in Sweden, Godtlevert and Adams Matkasse in Norway, and RetNemt in Denmark. In 2024, Cheffelo delivered around 16 million meals and generated SEK 1.1 billion in revenue. Cheffelo is listed on Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market (CHEF).

💡 What you get with us

At Cheffelo, you’ll be an important part of an innovative, forward-thinking, and inclusive company, named “Online Player of the Year” at Dagligvarugalan 2025. As Search Specialist, you’ll hold central responsibility for developing and optimizing Cheffelo’s digital visibility across the Nordics’ most recognized meal kit brands. You’ll gain a central place in an expert digital environment with high pace of change, getting to explore new technological opportunities and strengthen your skills in paid search and digital marketing. With us, you’ll help shape and develop future solutions, participate in innovation projects across disciplines, and contribute to Cheffelo’s continued growth in the Nordic market.

🎯 Your role at Cheffelo

As Search Specialist, you’ll take on a key role in the Growth Team, working closely with the Head of Media, Channel Lead, and the rest of the team to develop and execute effective campaigns for Cheffelo’s brands. You’ll be our expert across the search ecosystem—Google, Bing, AI Search, and other platforms—and have primary responsibility for strategic planning, setup, activation, optimization, analysis, and reporting of paid search campaigns. You’ll also take an active part in developing Cheffelo’s digital visibility together with SEO and website experts, and contribute to dynamic optimization and ongoing updates of digital processes.

🔑 Key responsibilities:


Develop and implement paid search strategies in collaboration with the Channel Lead
Ensure optimal planning, buying, activation, and reporting for paid search and display activities across the customer journey
Analyze and evaluate campaigns against marketing objectives and KPIs
Drive A/B testing and lift studies together with the Channel Lead and Analytics team
Implement and maintain strong routines and processes for search and display management
Manage campaigns using self-service and third-party tools (e.g., Smartly)
Explore and identify digital innovations and opportunities within search to strengthen our visibility
Collaborate with Growth and Analytics to improve investments through Geo Lift, incrementality analyses, and marketing mix modeling


🧠 Who are you?


3–5 years of experience with paid search, from either agency or client side
Higher education in marketing, communication, or similar field
Experience from subscription-based services in the Nordics is a plus
Deep analytical mindset and accustomed to using data for campaign design and optimization
Experienced with self-service and third-party search platforms (e.g., Smartly)
Strong collaboration and communication skills across teams
Fluent in English, with knowledge of a Scandinavian language being an advantage
Responsible, detail-oriented and enjoys challenging established solutions
Curious and ambitious


👋 Ready to take Cheffelo’s digital visibility to the next level?

Apply today and become a key member of our award-winning growth team!

Questions about the role? Please contact us at: career@cheffelo.com

Please note: We do not accept applications by email. Send your application via the link in this ad. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences, regardless of age, gender, religion, nationality, or ethnicity.
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Java) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
Place: Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Code generation and code review
Prompt evaluation and complex data annotation
Training and evaluation of large language models
Benchmarking and agent-based code execution in sandboxed environments
Working across multiple programming languages
Adapting guidelines for new domains and use cases
Following project-specific rubrics and requirements
Collaborating with project leads, solution engineers, and supply managers on complex or experimental projects


Note: Flexibility and quick adaptation to new requirements are essential.

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects that match your technical skills, on your own schedule. From coding and automation to fine-tuning AI outputs, you'll play a key role in advancing AI capabilities and real-world applications.

Requirements


You hold a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Software Development, Computer Engineering, Mobile App Development, Cloud Computing, Data Science, Big Data or other related fields
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in Java 17+, including streams API and concurrent programming
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
Hands-on experience with JUnit 5, TestNG, Mockito, and TestContainers
Proficiency with build tools (Maven, Gradle), IDEs (IntelliJ IDEA), and CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI)
Experience with the Spring ecosystem (Spring Boot, Spring Data, Spring Security), JPA/Hibernate
Strong understanding of JVM internals, garbage collection, performance optimization, and design patterns
Experience with messaging systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ) and microservices architectures
Practical use of AI-assisted tools for refactoring, performance analysis, and test generation
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), containers, and Kubernetes
Strong skills in JVM profiling (JProfiler, VisualVM) and debugging
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $52/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Product Student Assistant – Market & Competitor Analysis (Fintech / Cross-Border Payments)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a motivated and analytically minded Student Assistant to support our Product team. You will play a key role in helping us understand the evolving of digital payments landscape and its different railsby conducting structured market research, analyzing competitors, product data analysis, and transforming insights into actionable recommendations. This role is ideal for a student who is passionate about fintech, global payments, and data-driven decision-making.

Key Responsibilities


Market Research
Monitor trends in the global payments ecosystem, including regulatory updates, market shifts, and emerging technologies
Conduct research on regional payment methods, customer needs, and industry dynamics
Map ecosystem players (PSPs, banks, compliance providers, FX platforms, etc.) and identify opportunities for product innovation
Competitor Analysis
Track and evaluate competitor offerings, features, pricing structures, settlement models, and positioning
Build and maintain competitor comparison frameworks and dashboards
Provide concise summaries and insight reports to the Product team to support roadmap and strategy decisions
Data & Insight Support
Product data analysis - collect and analyse data to use in continuous product improvements such as product performance monitoring, customers’ feedback, inquiries and suggestions, etc.
Collect and structure quantitative and qualitative data to support product discovery and prioritization
Assist in preparing internal presentations, reports, and updates for Product, Sales, and Leadership
Support ad-hoc product research tasks as needed



What We’re Looking For


Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s program (Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Data, or related)
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to synthesize information and spot patterns
Interest in fintech, payments, or financial services—prior exposure is a plus but not required
Comfortable working with data from multiple sources and summarizing findings clearly
Independent, proactive, and curious, with strong attention to detail
Good communication skills and ability to present insights effectively



What We Offer


Hands-on exposure to real product challenges in a fast-growing fintech company enabling global payments
Opportunity to learn how product strategy is built in the payment industry
Flexible hours that fit around your studies
A supportive, collaborative team that values learning and growth



At Inpay, our core values drive our success. We seek individuals who embody these values:

Customer First: Demonstrate professionalism, prioritize customer satisfaction, and deliver high-quality results.

Raise the Bar: Maintain a positive attitude, foster resilience and adaptability, and strive for continuous improvement.

Accountability: Take responsibility for tasks, show initiative in problem-solving, and meet commitments.

Fearless Innovation: Embrace a growth mindset, seek learning opportunities, and drive innovation.

Together We Can: Build positive relationships, collaborate effectively, and support team success.

Action: Be proactive, action-oriented, and committed to delivering results.

If these values resonate with you, we want to hear from you!

Ready to join? Inpay is a cross-border payments company, connecting businesses and communities to a global banking network that helps them thrive. Since 2008, we've helped financial institutions, iGaming operators, corporates, NGOs, and others move money to the right places quickly, easily, and securely.

Our smart technology, innovative products, robust compliance, and in-house experts from 45+ countries solve complex payment challenges with an industry-leading 99% transaction success rate. We are regulated by the Danish Financial Supervisory Authority.

Our headquarters are in the royal quarter of central Copenhagen, with further offices in London. You can see a snapshot of what working life looks like here. Find out more about Inpay here.

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

Title: Data Scientist, Commercial Excellence - Denmark, Sweden, Netherlands, Finland, Germany or UK
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
At Arla Foods, we are committed to creating the future of dairy through innovation, sustainability, and collaboration. As a farmer-owned cooperative and one of the world’s leading dairy companies, we produce household-favourite brands while striving to make a positive impact on people and the planet.

We are now looking for an experienced, data-driven, curious, and growth-minded Data Scientist to join our Commercial Excellence Team. If you are passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights and want to make a real business impact, this is your opportunity.

How You Will Make An Impact

As a Data Scientist in the NRM Centre of the Excellence organisation, you will play a key role in supporting Arla’s growth and profitability ambitions across our European markets. This is a hands-on, operational role where you will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyse commercial data, develop advanced analytics tools, and translate insights into strategic decisions.

You will be the go-to expert for understanding our data landscape - identifying opportunities, addressing challenges, and helping shape the future of data science at Arla within the commercial space. Your key responsibilities will be to


Translate business objectives into data science problems and develop solutions that drive commercial value
Design, optimise, and deploy advanced analytics models to support NRM strategies
Continuously improve existing models and develop new ones to meet evolving business needs
Visualise insights using tools like Power BI and communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear, compelling way
Conduct exploratory data analysis, test hypotheses, and uncover trends and patterns
Ensure high-quality code, documentation, and scalable, stable solutions


For this position, you can be located in any of our core markets – Denmark, Sweden, Netherlands, Finland, Germany or UK.

What Will Make You Successful

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist who is not only technically skilled but also driven by curiosity and a passion for creating value. You are proactive and thrive on identifying opportunities for improvement, always ready to share new ideas and perspectives on how data can be leveraged to drive the business forward. Besides this, we imagine that you bring


A University degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics, mathematics, or data science
At least 2-5 years of hands-on experience after finalising university, where you have applied advanced analytics to real-world business problems
An analytical mindset with the ability to synthesize data from multiple sources
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience working with large, complex datasets (e.g., Nielsen, SAP, retailer ePOS)
Strong understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server)
Advanced Excel skills and strong data visualization capabilities (PowerBI or similar)
Preferably experience with Databricks


Please note that for this position, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship or relocation support.

What do we offer?

We are committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. You will join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favorite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world.

Application and contact

Please apply as soon as possible as we process applications on an ongoing basis. If you have any specific questions about the role, please reach out to Harri Härkönen, ‎Head of Commercial Digital Transformation, at harri.harkonen@arlafoods.com.

Shape the Future of Dairy

Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to enabling good food choices that make life better, providing people with natural, sustainable nourishment, while taking care at every step to ensure Arla is a choice they can feel good about. If you are looking to shape the future with an ambitious global cooperative that truly cares about your growth, where everyone feels valued and empowered, and collaboration is the core of culture, Arla is a choice you can feel good about.

Ref. 103161

Title: Night Receptionist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Radisson Hotel Group is one of the world's largest hotel groups with ten distinctive hotel brands, and more than 1,500 hotels in operation and under development in 95+ countries. The Group’s overarching brand promise is Every Moment Matters with a signature Yes I Can! service ethos. People are at the core of our business success and future. Our people are true Moment Makers and together we bring the culture, spirit, environment and opportunities that empower you to be your best, every day, everywhere, every time. Together, we make Every Moment Matter.





Job Description



Not a normal 9-5’er? Escape the ordinary and say Yes I Can!



We are currently seeking a Night Receptionist to join our vibrant team here at Radisson Collection Royal Hotel, Copenhagen. At Radisson Hotel Group we are in search of individuals who go beyond the resume – those with character, skills, talents, and a passion for creating memorable experiences.



As a Night Receptionist, you bring a heightened sense of responsibility, a focus on delivering exceptional service, and a dedication to ensuring a seamless and secure guest experience to our dynamic night team.



It’s not just about check-in and check-out during night hours; it’s about everything in-between.
You will be our guests’ superhero ensuring all aspects of the guest journey and experience are anticipated and delivered to the highest level
You will exude patience, empathy and have the personality to host the show
As an integral part of the team, you will work proactively to ensure guest satisfaction and the smooth running of the front office department


Qualifications


Flexibility and a positive, Yes I Can! Attitude
An eye for detail
Is a creative problem-solver
Passionate about creating extraordinary service
Ability to work as part of a team to ensure guest satisfaction
Strong verbal communication skills
Likes having fun at work
Experience in a similar position is beneficial but not essential


Additional Information



Why Join Radisson Hotel Group?



Live the Magic of Hospitality - Be part of a team that creates exceptional experiences and memorable moments every day. Let your Yes I Can! spirit shine as you bring hospitality to life.



Build a Great Career - No matter your background or experience, we invest in your growth, learning, and career development - helping you reach your full potential.



Experience the Team Spirit - Join a workplace that’s inclusive, fun, and meaningful. We celebrate diversity, support one another, and foster a sense of belonging through our Employee Resource Groups and inclusion initiatives.



Lead with Your Ambition - Your ideas, passion, and drive matter! We empower you to make a difference—in hospitality, your community and beyond.



Enjoy Global & Local Perks - No matter where you’re located, you’ll enjoy exclusive global benefits - like special hotel rates for you and your loved ones at our hotels worldwide. Plus, you’ll have access to local perks and rewards tailored to your country, making your experience even more rewarding!



Join us in shaping the future of hospitality! If you’re ready to bring your talent, energy, and passion, we’d love to hear from you.



Apply now and let’s make every moment matter.

Title: Scientific Business Analyst - Copenhagen, Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

TetraScience is the Scientific Data and AI company. We are catalyzing the Scientific AI revolution by designing and industrializing AI-native scientific data sets, which we bring to life in a growing suite of next gen lab data management solutions, scientific use cases, and AI-enabled outcomes.

TetraScience is the category leader in this vital new market, generating more revenue than all other companies in the aggregate. In the last year alone, the world's dominant players in compute, cloud, data, and AI infrastructure have converged on TetraScience as the de facto standard, entering into co-innovation and go-to-market partnerships: Latest News and Announcements | TetraScience Newsroom:

In connection with your candidacy, you will be asked to carefully review the Tetra Way letter, authored directly by Patrick Grady, our co-founder and CEO. This letter is designed to assist you in better understanding whether TetraScience is the right fit for you from a values and ethos perspective.

It is impossible to overstate the importance of this document and you are encouraged to take it literally and reflect on whether you are aligned with our unique approach to company and team building. If you join us, you will be expected to embody its contents each day.

Who You Are

You are a strategic, analytically minded professional with a passion for bridging scientific insights and cutting-edge technology. You thrive in environments where you can collaborate with scientists, product managers, and engineers to transform complex scientific data into actionable outcomes.

With deep domain knowledge in drug discovery/preclinical development, CMC, or Quality, you are skilled at uncovering innovative use cases that drive AI and machine learning applications. Your ability to engage with scientists and business leaders alike makes you a key player in maximizing the value of scientific data.

You will need to be a high clock speed and forward-thinking individual with a passion for developing requirements for complex solutions targeted to R&D and Quality personas inside of Life Sciences.

You will need to be a high clock-speed, forward-thinking individual with a passion for developing requirements for complex solutions targeted to R&D and Quality personas inside Life Sciences. You embody extreme ownership and have a demonstrated history of deriving maximum value from data through enrichment, analysis, and integration with AI and machine learning applications.

You should also be energized by regularly working onsite with customers. You thrive in dynamic, high-impact, face-to-face collaborative environments where you can build deep relationships and drive scientific transformation firsthand.

Requirements

What You Have Done


PhD with 15+ years of industry experience in life sciences, preferably across pharma, biotech, or health tech, with deep domain expertise in discovery, preclinical, CMC, and/or Quality
Extensive hands-on experience or direct oversight in one or more of the following areas: high throughput screening, preclinical toxicology, materials engineering, analytical development, drug substance (DS) synthesis and manufacturing
Delivered requirements for AI/ML-driven solutions in operational or productized environments that improved efficiency, reduced cost, and enhanced data utilization
Extensive hands-on experience with scientific data workflows and lab automation; exposure to FAIR principles and modern data architecture is a plus
Strong coding or scripting background (e.g., Python, Nextflow, AWS, SDKs) and familiarity with scientific tools, databases, and ontologies is preferred
Exceptional communication and storytelling ability to engage technical and executive stakeholders
Prior experience in customer-facing, consulting, or commercial-scientific interface roles


What You Will Do


Customer Data Exploration: Investigate diverse customer datasets, identifying enrichment and AI-readiness opportunities
Scientific Use Case Development: Collaborate with customers to define, iterate, and implement innovative scientific AI/ML use cases
Stakeholder Engagement: Conduct onsite interviews and workshops to deeply understand customer challenges and data landscapes
Data Analysis and Enrichment: Perform exploratory data analysis and define transformation workflows that enable scientific AI
Workflow Documentation: Develop visual documentation including workflow diagrams, ERDs, and ontology definitions
AI Model Evaluation: Provide practical scientific input on model output, with suggestions to improve real-world performance
Customer Enablement: Deliver onsite demonstrations, conduct working sessions, and act as a trusted advisor in AI adoption
Strategic Insight: Propose new directions, experiments, or platforms that can amplify scientific discovery and development


Benefits


Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company
Supportive, team-oriented culture of continuous improvement
Generous paid time off (PTO)
Remote working opportunities, when not at customer sites
Show more

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary and equity in a fast-growing company
  • Supportive, team-oriented culture of continuous improvement
  • Generous paid time off (PTO)
  • Remote working opportunities, when not at customer sites

Title: Replenishment Co-worker for early morning shifts, 12 hours per week, Aarhus
Place: Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
DERFOR ER VI HELT VILDE MED DIG
Elsker du at stå op før alle andre og bruge kroppen når du arbejder? Så vil du måske passe godt ind hos os i Replenishment, som Vareopfylder af boligtilbehør.

Replenishment spiller en vigtig rolle for IKEAs kunder og salg. Ikke alene sørger vi for, at vores lagertal er korrekte og opdaterede, vi sikrer også, at vores butik er i perfekt kommerciel stand, og at der er velopfyldt og klar til vores kunder kl. 10, når butikken åbner. Dette betyder, at Replenishment ikke kun handler om at genopfylde varer, men også om kundeservice og salgsoptimering.

I denne stilling ser vi gerne, at du:
• Har erfaring med og/eller trives med at arbejde i de tidlige morgentimer
• Er i god fysisk form og trives ved at bruge din krop aktivt
• Besidder et skarpt øje for detaljer og nyder at arbejde på en organiseret og struktureret måde
• Skal kunne kommunikere på engelsk og ivrig efter at samarbejde effektivt med teamet.

DINE ANSVARSOMRÅDER
Dine opgaver vil være:
• Vareopfyldning af boligtilbehør såsom tallerkener, puder, lamper, planter etc. med palleløfter, håndkraft
• Tæt opfølgning og samarbejde med dine kollegaer fra hele varehuset
• Varehåndtering og -optællinger.

SAMMEN SOM ET TEAM
Hos os bliver du en del af et internationalt team af både fuldtids- og deltidsmedarbejdere, som alle arbejder mod det samme fælles mål. Vi sikrer en effektiv vareopfyldning i varehuset og yder god service over for kunderne, selvom vi ikke har direkte kundekontakt. Vi arbejder tæt sammen med andre afdelinger, og du får derfor erfaring i at samarbejde med mange forskellige mennesker. Vi arbejder i et højt tempo, men har et rigtig godt sammenhold, hvor vi bakker hinanden op og løfter i flok. Der er derfor plads til at være lige præcis den, du er, og du har mulighed for at skabe et stærkt socialt netværk. Vi sørger for den rette oplæring, så du kan føle dig tryg og kompetent i jobbet.

HAR DU SPØRGSMÅL ELLER BRUG FOR HJÆLP? LAD OS TALE MED HINANDEN!
Du er velkommen til at kontakte Logistik Team leder, Burim Kurosi på burim.kurosi@ingka.ikea.com ved spørgsmål. Vi gør opmærksom på, at vi udelukkende modtager ansøgninger via vores rekrutteringssystem og IKKE via e-mail.

Øvrige informationer
• Stillingen er på 12 timer pr. uge i gennemsnit
• Din arbejdstid placeres primært i de tidlige morgentimer, kl 04:00-10:00, inden butikken åbner. Du skal også regne med at arbejde hver anden weekend, både lørdag og søndag. Det er muligt for dig, at komme med input til arbejdsplanen
• Løn inden for IKEAs lønramme for lager/logistik, herunder pension- og fritvalgsordning samt forskudttidstillæg
• Øvrige arbejdsvilkår følger HKs overenskomst for Handel&Viden
• Vi har diverse personalegoder som helbredsforsikring, massageordning, kantineordning, personalerabat, rabatordninger med samarbejdspartnere, årsgave osv.
• Der kan i ansættelsesprocessen blive stillet krav om fremvisning af straffeattest
• Ønsket opstart hurtigst muligt eller efter aftale
• Søg senest d. 14. december 2025
• OBS: Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler og forbeholder os retten til at lukke jobopslaget, når vi har modtaget tilstrækkeligt med relevante kandidater.

Ligesom vores hjem er vores talenter også mangfoldige, og i IKEA har vi en passion for rigtige mennesker. Ved jobsøgning er der nogle der kan miste modet, hvis de ikke opfylder alle kompetencer, men du er meget velkommen til stadig at ansøge. Vi vil gerne lære dig at kende og mulighederne er mange i IKEA, baseret på interesse, evner og erfaring - uanset om du er ung, senior eller derimellem. Vi håber, at du vil være med på rejsen og glæder os til at høre fra dig!


Show more

Title: Freelance AI Red Team Engineer
Place: Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Evaluate and red team AI models and agents and machine learning systems for vulnerabilities and safety risks.
Create offline reproducible & auto-evaluable test cases to test safety & capability of AI agents.
Develop and implement automation scripts, custom tools, environments and test harnesses.
Lead or contribute to security research initiatives, especially in AI safety, creating and implementing realistic and challenging attack scenarios for the model.
Advise on cybersecurity best practices and policy implications


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You hold a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity, Digital Forensics or other related fields.
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
Proficient in scripting and automation using Python, Bash, or PowerShell
Experienced with containerization and CI/CD security tools, especially Docker.
Hands-on experience with penetration testing across web, API, network, and infrastructure environments.
Knowledge of vulnerabilities in current AI models, including prompt injections, with knowledge of OWASP Top 10 for Large Language Models (LLMs)
Familiar with AI red-teaming frameworks such as garak or PyRIT.
Experience in AI/ML security, evaluation, and red teaming, particularly with LLMs, AI agents, and RAG pipelines.
Proficient in offensive exploitation and exploit development
Skilled in reverse engineering using tools like Ghidra or equivalents.
Expertise in network and application security, including web application security.
Knowledge of operating system security concepts such as Linux privilege escalation and Windows internals.
Familiar with secure coding practices for full-stack development.
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $56/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for creating AI Agents and making sure they provide real value in a production setting? Join a team where you can be yourself, contribute your perspective, and build AI solutions that make a real difference across Danske Bank.

Senior Data Scientist – GenAI Tribe

Do you have a passion for creating AI Agents and making sure they provide real value in a production setting? Join a team where you can be yourself, contribute your perspective, and build AI solutions that make a real difference across Danske Bank.

GenAI Tribe is Danske Bank’s centre for Generative AI. We focus on creating responsible AI solutions that support colleagues and customers across the Group. Working in partnership with product teams, engineers, risk specialists and compliance, we turn complex challenges into practical outcomes. Our aim is to support the safe and transparent use of emerging AI technologies across the organisation.

What will you be doing?

As a Senior Data Scientist in the GenAI Tribe, you will contribute to the design, development, monitoring and continual improvement of AI agents used across Danske Bank. You will work directly with models and tools, evaluate performance thoughtfully, and help ensure that every solution is reliable, safe and aligned with regulation. You will collaborate closely with colleagues from different disciplines as ideas progress from prototypes to fully supported solutions.

Your work will include:


Designing, implementing and refining AI agents for colleague and customer use cases
Developing evaluation approaches, metrics and monitoring systems that help us understand agent performance, safety and potential drift
Working with product, engineering, risk and compliance teams to deploy and evolve agents in production
Exploring new technologies such as platforms, services and libraries and writing up your assessments of them to help guide larger architectural choices
Contributing to shared standards for GenAI delivery, including testing, observability, documentation and lifecycle management
Driving processes with a lot of autonomy, communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences and management


About You

You enjoy working with others to understand problems and approach them in a thoughtful way. You bring experience with Generative AI and Python, and you are interested in building AI agents that are effective and functional. You value learning, enjoy knowledge-sharing, and can communicate complex topics in ways that make sense for different audiences.

Experience that would be helpful includes:


Practical work with GenAI or LLM-based solutions, including Python libraries such as Strands for agents capable of using integrated tools (beyond simple RAG setups)
Familiarity with evaluation and monitoring frameworks such as Arize Phoenix, LangWatch or Langfuse
Experience with cloud environments or delivery practices (such as AWS AgentCore, CI/CD frameworks such as Terraform or Azure Pipelines)
An interest in collaborating with stakeholders and supporting colleagues through mentoring or shared learning


What We Offer

You will be part of a community that values openness, collaboration and respectful challenge. We encourage an environment where people can express themselves authentically and contribute in ways that showcase their expertise. Flexible hybrid working is available, with two days a week from home.

Interested?

If you would like more information, please contact Mateusz Jurewicz at mjure@danskebank.dk or via LinkedIn . Please submit your application by 21.12.2025.

We look forward to hearing from you.

HTML:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for creating AI Agents and making sure they provide real value in a production setting? Join a team where you can be yourself, contribute your perspective, and build AI solutions that make a real difference across Danske Bank.

Senior Data Scientist – GenAI Tribe

 Do you have a passion for creating AI Agents and making sure they provide real value in a production setting? Join a team where you can be yourself, contribute your perspective, and build AI solutions that make a real difference across Danske Bank.

GenAI Tribe is Danske Bank’s centre for Generative AI. We focus on creating responsible AI solutions that support colleagues and customers across the Group. Working in partnership with product teams, engineers, risk specialists and compliance, we turn complex challenges into practical outcomes. Our aim is to support the safe and transparent use of emerging AI technologies across the organisation.

What will you be doing?

As a Senior Data Scientist in the GenAI Tribe, you will contribute to the design, development, monitoring and continual improvement of AI agents used across Danske Bank. You will work directly with models and tools, evaluate performance thoughtfully, and help ensure that every solution is reliable, safe and aligned with regulation. You will collaborate closely with colleagues from different disciplines as ideas progress from prototypes to fully supported solutions.

Your work will include:

  • Designing, implementing and refining AI agents for colleague and customer use cases
  • Developing evaluation approaches, metrics and monitoring systems that help us understand agent performance, safety and potential drift
  • Working with product, engineering, risk and compliance teams to deploy and evolve agents in production
  • Exploring new technologies such as platforms, services and libraries and writing up your assessments of them to help guide larger architectural choices
  • Contributing to shared standards for GenAI delivery, including testing, observability, documentation and lifecycle management
  • Driving processes with a lot of autonomy, communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences and management

About You

You enjoy working with others to understand problems and approach them in a thoughtful way. You bring experience with Generative AI and Python, and you are interested in building AI agents that are effective and functional. You value learning, enjoy knowledge-sharing, and can communicate complex topics in ways that make sense for different audiences.

Experience that would be helpful includes:

  • Practical work with GenAI or LLM-based solutions, including Python libraries such as Strands for agents capable of using integrated tools (beyond simple RAG setups)
  • Familiarity with evaluation and monitoring frameworks such as Arize Phoenix, LangWatch or Langfuse
  • Experience with cloud environments or delivery practices (such as AWS AgentCore, CI/CD frameworks such as Terraform or Azure Pipelines)
  • An interest in collaborating with stakeholders and supporting colleagues through mentoring or shared learning

What We Offer

You will be part of a community that values openness, collaboration and respectful challenge. We encourage an environment where people can express themselves authentically and contribute in ways that showcase their expertise. Flexible hybrid working is available, with two days a week from home.

Interested?

If you would like more information, please contact Mateusz Jurewicz at mjure@danskebank.dk or via LinkedIn . Please submit your application by 21.12.2025.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Two Postdoctorate Fellowships in Explainable AI and Computational Law
Company: LEO Foundation Skin Immunology Research Center (SIC)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job portal
Faculty and academic p...


Two Postdoctorate Fellowships in Explainable AI and Computational Law

The Department of Computer Science invites applicants for two 24 month postdoctorate positions in Explainable AI and Computational Law for Legal Decision-making.

The positions are affiliated to respectively the LEXplain (Explainability requirements for AI used in legal decision-making) project and the larger research project “XHAILe” (Explainable Hybrid AI for Computational Law and Accurate Legal Chatbots) affiliated to the AI Pioneer Centre. Both projects are in collaboration with the Faculty of Law at Copenhagen University. LEXplain is funded by the Research Council of Norway and further involves Faculty of Law, University of Bergen and the Danish startup company Pandektes developing state-of-the art AI tools for legal analysis. XHAILe is financed by Innovation Fund Denmark and further involves Department of Nordic Studies and Linguistics, DTU Compute, and industrial partners: DCR Solutions, KL (Local Government Denmark), TietoEvry, and Lexoforms.

Start date is 1st March, 2025 or as soon as possible thereafter.

The projects

The LEXPLAIN project aims to research the explainability requirements for legal decisions and how AI technologies can fulfill such requirements when used for legal decision-making.

The XHAILE project aims to provide efficient and accurate hybrid AI technologies for computational law and natural language interaction with e-government solutions along with trustworthy benchmarks and guidelines for legal use of the technology.

The successful candidate is expected to conduct research in the different types of AI, including Generative, Symbolic and Neuro-symbolic AI for computational law and legal decision-making and to contribute with knowledge on these topics to the inter-disciplinary work in the project group.

The research will partly explore the combination of generative AI with the research in symbolic AI and logic for computational law carried out by the PI and his research groups, centred around the development of a graph-based modelling language, DCR Graphs, for the declarative modelling of law and business processes. The DCR Graphs language is today used widely and successfully in the public sector.

The candidate is asked to target the motivation for the application in relation to the two projects and indicate preferences if any.

Further information about the LEXplain research project can be found at: www4.uib.no/en/research/research-projects/lexplain

Further information about the XHAILe research can be found at: https://di.ku.dk/english/research/research-projects/xhaile/

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for candidates with a PhD degree and demonstrable experience in the field of AI for legal decision support or formal logic or declarative modelling of decisions and business processes.

Our group and research- and what do we offer?

The postdoctorate Fellow will be positioned at the Computer Science Department, University of Copenhagen, in the research section for Software, Data, People & Society. There will be close collaboration with the industry partners, and regular collaboration with the other academic partners. The project has the ambition to play an important role in the trustworthy and effective application of AI for legal decision support.

The University of Copenhagen was founded in 1479 and is the oldest and largest university in Denmark. It is often ranked as the best university in Scandinavia and consistently as one of the top places in Europe. Within computer science, it is ranked number 2 in the European Union according to the Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU) 2021. Copenhagen is one of the 10 most livable cities in the world with a rich culture within music, theater and associations. Life for families is made easy by a publicly supported daycare and health care system, dual career opportunities, maternity/parental leave and six weeks of paid annual vacation. International candidates may find information on living and working in Denmark here. Useful information is also available at The International Staff Mobility office (ISM) at the University of Copenhagen (link). ISM offers a variety of services to international researchers coming to and working at the University of Copenhagen.

The duties of the postdoc will include research and publication/scientific communication within Explainable AI for Legal Decision-making.

To a limited extent the positions may also include other duties.

Filing of application

The application including all attachments must be in English and submitted electronically by clicking APPLY NOW below.

Applying for the postdoc position please include


Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master and PhD degree or equivalent)
Research plan – description of current and future research plans
Complete publication list
Separate reprints of 3 particularly relevant papers


The deadline for applications is 7 December 2025 23:59

After the expiry of the deadline for applications, the authorized recruitment manager selects applicants for assessment on the advice of the Interview Committee.

You can read about the recruitment process at: https://employment.ku.dk/faculty/recruitment-process/.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Thomas Troels Hildebrandt

E-mail: kbl854@ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 07-12-2025

Employment start: 01-03-2026

Working hours: Full time

Department/Location: Department of Computer Science

Title: HR Manager (Generalist)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Overview

We are seeking an experienced HR Manager (Generalist) to join our Nordic HR team in Denmark. As a HR Generalist you will primarily work for the Denmark entity but support the wider HR Generalist needs of the Europe North HR Organisation.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Maintain and update HR policies and practices to ensure compliance with Danish labor law and other relevant regulations.
Partner with the wider HR Ecosystem to ensure Denmark compliance and employee experience delivery.
Support various projects and initiatives, such as onboarding changes, M&A activity, policy & process related changes.
Facilitate HR governance processes and maintain accurate HR information across the organization (e.g. immigration, mobility, offer governance).
Work collaboratively and pro-actively with the business, local employee representative groups and committees to support statutory and compliance requirements creating trusted working relationships.
Represent Denmark as part of the wider EMEA ONEHR team identifying needs, developing plans, and implementing
Represent HR in compliance and governance committees and collaborate with stakeholders including Finance, Payroll, Procurement, and Legal.
Delivering data driven business insights on HR related projects to business leaders, as and when required, creating efficient and automated reports to guide policy.
Be the main contact for crisis management and business continuity planning, such as emergency response, disaster recovery, and employee well-being programs.
Develop and manage employee engagement programs and activities, including resource groups and well-being initiatives.
Act as a coach to managers who need leadership guidance and accountability to maintain a high performance culture.


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources (HR), Legal, Business, Psychology, or related field AND many years experience with HR or related experience (e.g., hiring, training, performance management) involving applicable employment laws and policies
OR equivalent experience.
Demonstratable expert knowledge of Danish Union negotiations, operating in an international or matrixed environment
Professional or native oral and written communication in Danish and English

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist til Danica, Business Data & Analytics SUL
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Er du klar til at drive udviklingen inden for data og teknologi?

Brænder du for at kombinere avancerede teknologier som AI, Python og VBA med en stærk forretningsforståelse? Vil du være med til at skabe fremtidens løsninger og levere værdifuld indsigt, der gør en forskel? Så har vi brug for dig som Data Scientist i vores Business Data & Analytics SUL team hos Danica.

Om afdelingen

Business Data & Analytics SUL teamet er en del af CFO-området, hvor vi understøtter Danica med datadrevne analyser og løsninger, der skaber vækst og værdi. I denne rolle vil du primært supportere forretningsområdet Health and Care, hvor data spiller en afgørende rolle i at optimere processer og levere indsigter, der sikrer en god kundeoplevelse. Afdelingen arbejder tæt sammen med forretningen og ledelsen for at sikre, at data bliver en strategisk ressource.

Om teamet

Du bliver en del af et ambitiøst og professionelt team, der arbejder med hele datarejsen – fra indsamling og transformering til analyser og visualisering. Vi prioriterer vidensdeling og samarbejde, og vi har en uformel og åben kultur, hvor vi løfter hinanden fagligt og arbejder på tværs af organisationen. Teamet er kendetegnet ved en høj faglig standard og en stærk interesse for at udforske nutidige og fremtidige teknologier.

Om rollen

Som Data Scientist i Business Data & Analytics SUL teamet får du en central rolle i at drive brugen af avancerede teknologier og værktøjer. Du vil støtte op om Health and Care-forretningsområdet og levere analyser, der understøtter beslutningsprocesser og optimerer kundeoplevelsen. Dine ansvarsområder vil blandt andet inkludere:


Udvikle og implementere løsninger ved hjælp af teknologier som AI, Python, SQL Alteryx og VBA.
Erfaring med datavisualiseringsværktøjer, som f.eks. Tableau, til at udarbejde visuelle rapporter og interaktive dashboards
Identificere nye muligheder for at anvende data og teknologi i organisationen.
Drive udviklingen af datamodelværktøjer og visualiseringer, der støtter op om forretningsmål.
Samarbejde med interessenter for at forstå deres behov og omsætte dem til teknologiske løsninger.


Om dig

Vi søger en Data Scientist, der er nysgerrig og passioneret omkring data og teknologi. Du har en stærk teknisk baggrund og lysten til at udforske og implementere fremtidens værktøjer. Din evne til at kombinere teknisk dygtighed med forretningsforståelse er afgørende. Derudover:


Har du stærke kompetencer inden for AI, Python og VBA.
Har du erfaring med dataanalyse og datavisualisering, og kan omsætte komplekse data til klare indsigter.
Er du proaktiv og opsøgende i forhold til at identificere nye muligheder og udfordringer.
Har du gode samarbejdsevner og evnen til at formidle tekniske løsninger til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.


"Vi søger en Data Scientist, der kan kombinere teknologisk nysgerrighed med forretningsfokus. Hos os får du frihed til at drive projekter, skabe løsninger og levere dataindsigt, der gør en reel forskel – både for forretningen og vores kunder." – Johan Majland Burgaard, Head of Business Data & Analytics SUL

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen?

Kontakt Johan Majland Burgaard, Head of Business Data & Analytics SUL, på jmbu@danica.dk eller telefon 2670 3404.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!
Show more

Place: Store Heddinge, Region Zealand, Denmark
Description:

Forædlingsassistent

Job Family: R&D

Business Unit: DLF Research & Development

Location:

Store Heddinge, DK, 4660

Forædlingsassistent

DLF søger en forædlingsassistent til Store Heddinge

DLF’s Research & Development afdeling søger en forædlingsassistent til vores forsøgsstation i Store Heddinge.

”We enrich life, people and land through seeds and science.”

DLF er en danskejet, global organisation med omkring 2.000 medarbejdere i 22 lande verden over. DLF er førende inden for udvikling og salg af græsfrø af høj kvalitet. Når du bliver en del af DLF, bliver du en del af en forskningsdreven organisation med fokus på kvalitet, innovation og bæredygtighed.

Om stillingen

Som assistent i vores planteforædling vil du blive en del af et dedikeret team, der udvikler produkter inden for både plæne- og fodergræs. Rollen kombinerer anvendt forsøgsarbejde i marken med forsøg/opgaver i drivhus og laboratorie, der understøtter forædlings- og product management arbejdet. Du vil understøtte innovativ forskning i planteavl og frøproduktion. Arbejdstiden er på 37 timer om ugen, men der kan i spidsbelastede perioder (sæsonbestemt) godt forekomme behov for ekstra arbejde.

Dine hovedopgaver


Evaluere markforsøg (græsplæne, fodergræs og frøudbytte) ved hjælp af håndholdte computere og droner
Uploade, registrere og administrere data i forædlingssoftware
Organisere og udføre rutinemæssige screeningsforsøg i laboratoriet og drivhuset
Samarbejde med det agronomiske personale for at sikre maksimal kvalitet af markforsøg
Bidrage til løbende forbedringer af forsøgsmetoder, optimering af arbejdsgange og brug af udstyr
Koordinere, samarbejde og rapportere forsøgsstatus til forædlere og product management i forskellige lande


Hvem er du?

Vi Ønsker, At Du Er En Person Med Grønne Fingre Og Lyst Til At Arbejde Udendørs i Alt Slags Vejr. Derudover Har Du:


En professionsbachelor i jordbrug, MSc eller BSc i agronomi, havebrug eller et beslægtet felt.
Brancheerfaring vil være et plus
Kendskab til agronomi/havebrug, fysiologi, patologi, planteernæring og digitale værktøjer
Gode kommunikations- og problemløsningsevner
Stærke organisatoriske evner med sans for detaljer, herunder multitasking, prioritering og opfølgningsevner
Rutine med Windows Office pakken, herunder håndholdte og stationære computere og databasesoftware
Flydende engelsk i skrift og tale
Gyldigt kørekort


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig

DLF opfordrer alle kvalificerede ansøgere om at søge, uanset baggrund, køn eller alder. Derfor ønsker vi ikke, at du skriver personfølsomme oplysninger i din ansøgning.

Lyder stillingen som noget for dig? Tøv ikke med at sende din ansøgning til os – vi tager også imod ansøgninger på engelsk.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Forædlingsassistent

Job Family: R&D

Business Unit: DLF Research & Development

Location:

Store Heddinge, DK, 4660

Forædlingsassistent

DLF søger en forædlingsassistent til Store Heddinge

DLF’s Research & Development afdeling søger en forædlingsassistent til vores forsøgsstation i Store Heddinge.

”We enrich life, people and land through seeds and science.”

DLF er en danskejet, global organisation med omkring 2.000 medarbejdere i 22 lande verden over. DLF er førende inden for udvikling og salg af græsfrø af høj kvalitet. Når du bliver en del af DLF, bliver du en del af en forskningsdreven organisation med fokus på kvalitet, innovation og bæredygtighed.

Om stillingen

Som assistent i vores planteforædling vil du blive en del af et dedikeret team, der udvikler produkter inden for både plæne- og fodergræs. Rollen kombinerer anvendt forsøgsarbejde i marken med forsøg/opgaver i drivhus og laboratorie, der understøtter forædlings- og product management arbejdet. Du vil understøtte innovativ forskning i planteavl og frøproduktion. Arbejdstiden er på 37 timer om ugen, men der kan i spidsbelastede perioder (sæsonbestemt) godt forekomme behov for ekstra arbejde.

Dine hovedopgaver

  • Evaluere markforsøg (græsplæne, fodergræs og frøudbytte) ved hjælp af håndholdte computere og droner
  • Uploade, registrere og administrere data i forædlingssoftware
  • Organisere og udføre rutinemæssige screeningsforsøg i laboratoriet og drivhuset
  • Samarbejde med det agronomiske personale for at sikre maksimal kvalitet af markforsøg
  • Bidrage til løbende forbedringer af forsøgsmetoder, optimering af arbejdsgange og brug af udstyr
  • Koordinere, samarbejde og rapportere forsøgsstatus til forædlere og product management i forskellige lande

Hvem er du?

Vi Ønsker, At Du Er En Person Med Grønne Fingre Og Lyst Til At Arbejde Udendørs i Alt Slags Vejr. Derudover Har Du:

  • En professionsbachelor i jordbrug, MSc eller BSc i agronomi, havebrug eller et beslægtet felt.
  • Brancheerfaring vil være et plus
  • Kendskab til agronomi/havebrug, fysiologi, patologi, planteernæring og digitale værktøjer
  • Gode kommunikations- og problemløsningsevner
  • Stærke organisatoriske evner med sans for detaljer, herunder multitasking, prioritering og opfølgningsevner
  • Rutine med Windows Office pakken, herunder håndholdte og stationære computere og databasesoftware
  • Flydende engelsk i skrift og tale
  • Gyldigt kørekort

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig

DLF opfordrer alle kvalificerede ansøgere om at søge, uanset baggrund, køn eller alder. Derfor ønsker vi ikke, at du skriver personfølsomme oplysninger i din ansøgning.

Lyder stillingen som noget for dig? Tøv ikke med at sende din ansøgning til os – vi tager også imod ansøgninger på engelsk.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Title: Speditør/Shipping Trainee
Company: Energy, Ports & Projects - Blue Water Shipping
Place: Aalborg, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Vil du have branchens bedste uddannelse med masser af karrieremuligheder? Får du et kick af at finde den rigtige løsning? Søger du et fællesskab, job og uddannelse, hvor du nemt kan kombinere teori og praksis? Start din karriere hos Blue Water Shipping med en uddannelse fyldt med muligheder.

Vi tilbyder en udviklende 2-årig speditør-/shippinguddannelse med opstart i både marts og september 2026, der med garanti vil udfordre og styrke dig både fagligt og personligt.

En hverdag med fart på og et godt sted at være

Som Speditør/Shipping Trainee hos Blue Water bliver du den, der får gods sikkert frem over hele verden – fra planlægning og booking af transport til at løse uventede udfordringer undervejs. Du har kontakt med både kunder, leverandører og samarbejdspartnere, og det er dig, der sikrer, at alt går op i en højere enhed. Er du nysgerrig, har du flair for godt købmandskab og kan du levere en fantastisk kundeservice – så er jobbet som speditør lige noget for dig.

Du kommer til at lære fra dygtige og erfarne kollegaer, og du får hurtigt ansvar for egne opgaver og kunder. Du bliver en del af en unik arbejdskultur og et team, hvor samarbejde og gode relationer er i centrum – både med kollegaer, kunder og andre trainees fra hele Verden.

Få branchens bedste uddannelse i Blue Waters eget Academy

Hos Blue Water får du branchens stærkeste speditøruddannelse og to uddannelser på én gang: både en EUD-speditøruddannelse og en akademiuddannelse i International Transport og Logistik (60 ECTS-point). Her kombinerer vi praksis i hverdagen med målrettet undervisning i bl.a. logistik, transportjura og supply chain management – alt sammen tilrettelagt og faciliteret af vores eget academy. Undervisningen foregår på engelsk og veksler mellem fysiske ophold i Esbjerg og online læring.

Under dit skoleophold på hovedkontoret i Esbjerg bor du sammen med andre trainees i gode rammer, hvor der er plads til både afslapning og fælles måltider. Her opstår et stærkt fællesskab, hvor sociale aktiviteter og oplevelser på tværs af kulturer skaber varige relationer og et netværk, der styrker både din faglige og personlige udvikling.

Lær fra erfarne kollegaer og sæt retning på din karriere

Vores speditør-/shippinguddannelse er lavet til dig, der vil have den bedste start på din speditørkarriere – og du behøver ikke vide noget om spedition på forhånd. Har du nysgerrighed, gåpåmod og lyst til at lære, så lærer vi dig resten undervejs.

For at blive trainee skal du have afsluttet HF, HHX, STX, HTX eller EUX (og har du STX, HTX eller HF, skal du også tage et 5-ugers EUS-forløb). Du skal også kunne læse, skrive og tale engelsk uden problemer.

Når du er færdig, har du gode muligheder for at fortsætte hos os – faktisk bliver 9 ud af 10 trainees ansat bagefter. Her kan din udvikling fortsætte hos Blue Water med et job i udlandet, yderligere specialisering eller nye udfordringer, der matcher dine ambitioner.

Ansøgningsprocessen

Vil du med på holdet? Send dit CV og en kort ansøgning, hvor du fortæller, hvorfor du vil være speditør hos os. Vi læser ansøgningerne løbende og inviterer til online screeningssamtale – så jo før du søger, jo bedre! De bedste bliver inviteret til en fysisk samtale i uge 3, 4 eller 5.

Har du spørgsmål eller er du nysgerrig på at høre mere om det at være trainee i Blue Water, så er du velkommen til at kontakte Senior Specialist Talent Attraction, Jonas Marvig Jensen på jmje@bws.dk.

Together we create solutions

Vi er en stolt familieejet virksomhed, grundlagt i Danmark i 1972, og global leverandør af alle logistiktjenester inden for moderne supply chain management. Vores værdigrundlag lever i dag i bedste velgående og er drevet af en udpræget entreprenørånd og godt købmandskab. Vores medarbejdere tilbydes derfor et stærkt fagligt miljø med store frihedsgrader, som sikrer vores kunder den bedste service.

Blue Water Shipping er blandt Danmarks mest alsidige speditører og vores kunders lokale samarbejdspartner. Vi er repræsenteret med 2.700 medarbejdere i 30 lande verden over, der kombinerer et stærkt globalt netværk med lokal ekspertise, som gør, at vi kan tilbyde komplette og skræddersyede løsninger til ethvert forsendelsesbehov overalt i verden.
Show more
